thread.title: Local roundup: Ex-Centaur helps UConn women's soccer extend streak
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Ex-Centaur helps UConn women's soccer extend streak

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Ex-Centaur helps UConn women's soccer extend streak
text: • H.S. football notebook: Killingly well prepared for physical play... TULSA, Okla. — Woodstock Academy alum Andrea Plucenik scored her fourth goal of the season early in the second half to help the No. 15 UConn women’s soccer team earn its sixth straight win with a 2-1 victory over Tulsa in double overtime in an American Athletic Conference game on Sunday afternoon. Samantha McGuire scored the game-winner in the second overtime period for the Huskies (14-2, 6-1). Liana Hinds assisted on Plucenik’s goal and Stephanie Ribeiro assisted on McGuire’s goal. WOMEN’S FIELD HOCKEY UConn 5 Boston University 0 STORRS — Casey Umstead recorded a hat trick and Nina Klein made three saves to lead the No. 2 Huskies to their 15th straight win of the season and seventh straight shutout. Roisin Upton and Amelia Iacobucci also scored for UConn (15-0), which has not lost since Spet. 28, 2014 against North Carolina, a winning streak of 29 games. WOMEN’S ICE HOCKEY UConn 3 Colgate 3 (OT) STORRS — The Huskies rallied from a two-goal deficit in the third period to salvage a tie. Trailing 3-1, Leah Buress scored a power-play goal just past the halfway mark of the third period and Brittany Berisoff tied the game less than four minutes later. Margaret Zimmer scored the first goal in the second period for UConn (1-1-2). FROM SATURDAY Newtown 2 East Lyme 0 NEWTOWN — Michael Trailor made seven saves but the Vikings (10-3) were shut out on the road. By The Bulletin
